title: Representative Disk
text: The following figure shows the function and a representative disk that can be used to estimate the volume. Notice that since we are revolving the function around the y-axis, the disks are horizontal, rather than vertical.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Set Up the Integral
text: Select the appropriate integral for finding the volume of the solid.
speech: Select the appropriate integral for finding the volume of the solid.
pacedSpeech: Select the appropriate integral for finding the volume of the solid.

title: Integrate the Formula
text: Find the volume of the solid using the disk method. The volume of the solid of revolution formed by revolving R around the y-axis using the disk method is given by $$V=\int_{a}^{b} \pi {f{\left(y\right)}}^2 \,dy$$.
speech: Find the volume of the solid using the disk method. The volume of the solid of revolution formed by revolving R around the y-axis using the disk method is given by    v is equal to the integral from a to b of pi f of y squared, d y .

title: Integrate the Formula
text: What is the volume of the solid of revolution?
